info.game_comments: 4th regular play game that didn't have a winner.

(1, 1).clue: The original natives of this U.S. state have the Kumulipo, a 2,000-line poem of the creation

(2, 1).clue: This largest lake in Africa is also the main reservoir of the Nile River

(4, 1).clue: The beautiful Snake River Canyon is a highlight of this state

(6, 1).clue: In 2015 Yahoo! began streaming this former NBC series about Jeff, Abed & their higher learning gang

(1, 2).clue: Later the top Norse god, with his brothers he slew the giant Ymir & constructed the world from the corpse

(2, 2).clue: This Florida lake bears a Hitchiti name that means "big water"

(3, 2).clue: B:A towering building project in Genesis 11:4-9

(4, 2).clue: Seen here is a mug shot of this once powerful man in Alcatraz, his home from 1934 to 1939

(6, 2).clue: Title last name of Harry (aka Hieronymus), Michael Connelly's L.A. detective played by Titus Welliver

(1, 3).clue: A Chinese myth says the god P'an-ku was born from these 2 competing principles to make heaven & earth

(2, 3).clue: Mosul, one of Iraq's largest cities, lies on the west bank of this river

(4, 3).clue: The caricature seen here was adopted by this university in 1964

(5, 3).clue: Puppetry artist Basil Twist was among the 2015 recipients of this foundation's "Genius" grants

(6, 3).clue: Her "unbreakable" extended theme "White dudes hold the record for creepy crimes but females are strong as hell"

(1, 4).clue: This sun god who rose from the Ocean of Chaos & was reborn daily gained prominence in Egypt's 5th Dynasty

(2, 4).clue: The principal river of Tuscany rises on Monte Falterona

(3, 4).clue: D:Adjective meaning "sweet", like a pleasant tone

(4, 4).clue: In 2015 this Utah man was third in line in presidential succession

(5, 4).clue: In 2014 Isabel Allende was among the recipients of this medal, the highest civilian honor awarded by our chief executive

(6, 4).clue: 8 people telepthically experience each other's lives in "Sense8", created in part by these "Matrix" siblings

(1, 5).clue: "Theogony" by Hesiod says the first children of this Greek earth goddess had no father

(2, 5).clue: In 1699 Sieur d'Iberville saw Okwata, a vast lake near the Gulf of Mexico, & renamed it this

(3, 5).clue: E:Latin plural for mistakes in a text

(4, 5).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a video of different rail vehicles on the monitor.)  Let's clear this up: a cable car runs on an underground cable; a similar vehicle using overhead wires may be called a streetcar, a tram or this, also the name of the pole that connects it to the wires

(5, 5).clue: He got 2 ticker-tape parades in NYC's Canyon of Heroes: one in 1962 & the other in 1998, after a 2nd trip to space

(6, 5).clue: In 2015 Jeffrey Tambor went through some big changes & won a Golden Globe for his role on this Amazon series

(1, 1).clue: "Monkey Planet" was an alternative title of this Pierre Boulle novel that spawned a movie series

(2, 1).clue: In Yiddish a shvitz is a sauna or steam bath; to shvitz is this, what you do in those

(3, 1).clue: When this risk is "limited" the potential loss is fixed at a maximum

(5, 1).clue: On Oct. 5, 1789 thousands of women marched to Versailles to protest the high price & scarcity of this foodstuff

(6, 1).clue: Scientists said one of these was 130 when it died in 2007; in its neck was a harpoon point made around 1880

(1, 2).clue: From the creator of Cap. Underpants comes "Rickey Ricotta's Mighty Robot vs. the Uranium Unicorns" of this planet

(2, 2).clue: From the French for "loosening", it was a loosening of tensions between the U.S. & Soviet Union in the 1970s

(3, 2).clue: 2-word term for a company's total assets minus total expenses & debts

(5, 2).clue: A the time of the revolution, it had 8 towers & was surrounded by a moat more than 80 feet wide

(6, 2).clue: The microscopic water this--we nicknamed it "Ursus smallus"--can slow its metabolism to 0.01% of normal & live up to a century

(1, 3).clue: Other books by this author include "Mars & Venus in the Bedroom" & "The Mars & Venus Diet & Exercise Solution"

(2, 3).clue: German for "fear", it's used as a psychological term for anxiety mixed with uncertainty

(3, 3).clue: From the Old French for "remove from a purse", it means to pay out money from a fund

(5, 3).clue: He tried to escape France but was caught after a patriot recognized him from his picture on French currency

(6, 3).clue: Marvel fans know to hail this creature that replaces all the cells in its body in a few weeks & never grows old

(1, 4).clue: This 1931 novel was written by a missionaries' daughter who went on to win a Nobel Prize

(2, 4).clue: To avoid being overheard, you speak this way in soft tones, Italian for "under voice"

(3, 4).clue: Beloit is a liberal arts college; this Big 4 accounting firm that rhymes with Beloit has its own university

(5, 4).clue: In 1790 a tricolor flag replaced one that featured this floral emblem

(6, 4).clue: Defying a Coleridge poem, this type of bird was 64 when she laid an egg in 2015

(1, 5).clue: "The Moons of Jupiter" is a short story collection by this Canadian female author of "Lives of Girls & Women"

(2, 5).clue: It's Latin for "from the chair", referring to the seat of authority from which the pope issues infallible decrees

(5, 5).clue: At the start of the revolution, the 3 of these represented the clergy, the nobility & the people

(6, 5).clue: This crustacean can survive for 100 years; the Norway type often doesn't get close to that, as it's delicious

(0, 0).clue: A 1957 event led to the creation of a National Historic Site in this city, signed into law by a president whose library is now there too
